(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) | clubnumber = 25 | youthyears1 = 2005–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] | years1 = 2012–2016 | clubs1 = [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] | caps1 = 130 | goals1 = 9 | years2 = 2016– | clubs2 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps2 = 27 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] (loan) | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | club-update = 04:18, 26 August 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Samuel Mark Byram''' (born 16 September 1993) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. He primarily plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]], but can also play as a [[Midfielder#Winger|right midfielder or right winger]].{{cite web|title=Luke showed what we've been miss-ing!|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/luke-showed-what-we-ve-been-miss-ing-1-5082500|work=Yorkshire Evening Post|accessdate=2 November 2012|date=2 November 2012}} Byram was called up to the [[England national under-20 football team|England Under 20 team]] for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] but withdrew from the squad through injury and remains uncapped at international level. ==Club career== Byram was born in [[Thurrock]], [[Essex]], before moving north, where he attended Ralph Butterfield Primary School, [[Haxby]], and then [[Joseph Rowntree School]] in [[York]]. He played for the City Schools team as a boy before joining [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].{{Cite news | url = http://www.yorkpress.co.uk/archive/2003/10/15/York+Archive/7898168.print/ | title = Five-star York are in fine Nick | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = York Press. | date = 15 October 2003}} After completing his secondary education at school, he signed scholar forms with the West Yorkshire club in 2010. During his first year as scholar, he played 'down' a year in the under-16 team to help his development as a footballer.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120820/sam-signs-up-for-the-future_2247585_2895119 | title = SAM SIGNS UP FOR THE FUTURE | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 20 August 2012}} He later progressed to his age group in the under-18s where he would become a regular in the team during his second year in 2011–12. As an integral part of the team, he scored several goals over the course of the season as the under-18s finished as runners-up to [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in their divisional academy league.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120425/united-pride-in-runners-up-spot_2247585_2748334 | title = UNITED PRIDE IN RUNNERS-UP SPOT | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 25 April 2012 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120531132718/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120425/united-pride-in-runners-up-spot_2247585_2748334# | archive-date = 31 May 2012 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }} Following the end of the season in May 2012, he was one of five young players rewarded with their first professional contracts for their performances in the campaign.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120502/the-magnificent-seven_2247585_2757299 | title = THE MAGNIFICENT SEVEN | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 2 May 2012}} ===Leeds United=== ====2012–13 season==== [[File:Sam Byram.jpg|thumb|175px|Byram playing for [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in 2012]] In the first friendly match of Leeds United's 2012–13 pre-season against [[Farsley Celtic F.C.|Farsley Celtic]], Byram was one of a number of youngsters given an opportunity to impress manager [[Neil Warnock]] when he lined up for the second half at [[Throstle Nest]].{{Cite news | url = http://www.leeds.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=287701 | title = LUFC Five star Leeds see off Farsley Celtic | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Vital Football | date = 20 July 2012}} United recorded a convincing 5–2 victory over their city rivals. Nevertheless, he would travel with the first-team on their summer tour of the South West of England the following week, featuring in the games against [[Tavistock A.F.C.|Tavistock]], [[Bodmin Town F.C.|Bodmin Town]] and [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]].{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120723/united-hit-tavistock-for-six_2247585_2857883 | title = UNITED HIT TAVISTOCK FOR SIX | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 23 July 2012}}{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120725/four-star-united-win-at-bodmin_2247585_2860492 | title = FOUR-STAR UNITED WIN AT BODMIN | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 25 July 2012}}{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120727/south-west-tour-ends-on-a-high_2247585_2863115 | title = SOUTH WEST TOUR ENDS ON A HIGH | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 27 July 2012}} Byram remained as part of the first-team in pre-season after returning to the North; playing for an hour and scoring in the game away to [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]].{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120804/three-of-the-best-see-off-preston_2247585_2870743 | title = THREE OF THE BEST SEE OFF PRESTON | accessdate = 4 August 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 4 August 2012}} After impressing in pre-season, Byram was handed the number 25 shirt for the season ahead and he made his first team debut at [[Elland Road]] in a 4–0 victory over [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] on 11 August in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120811/shrewsbury-live_2247585_2878205 | title = SHREWSBURY LIVE | accessdate = 11 August 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 11 August 2012}} Byram retained his place in the first-team the following week in United's first league game of the campaign against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. He was part of a defence that kept a clean-sheet in a 1–0 victory over one of the early favourites for promotion and his performance out-wide against the [[England national football team|England]] international [[Matt Jarvis]] won praise from several observers.{{Cite news| url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120818/united-open-up-with-a-winner_2247585_2889721 | title = Becchio goal secures win against Wolves... | accessdate = 18 August 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 18 August 2012}} He signed a new three-year contract with the West Yorkshire club two days after his league debut and only three months after signing his first professional contract with the club.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120820/sam-signs-up-for-the-future_2247585_2895119 | title = Sam Signs Up for the Future | accessdate = 20 August 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 20 August 2012}} Byram scored his first professional goal on 28 August in the 3–0 League Cup second-round victory over [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]]. Picking up the ball just outside the penalty area, he beat two Oxford defenders with his first and second touches before chipping the goalkeeper from inside the box in the 34th minute to give his team a 2–0 lead.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120828/oxford-live_2247585_2902951 | title = OXFORD LIVE | accessdate = 28 August 2012 | publisher = Leeds United F.C.| date = 28 August 2012}} An impressed Neil Warnock told reporters after the game that "Sam will probably never score another goal like that in his career".{{Cite news | url = http://www.sportinglife.com/football/live/match-reaction/273452/warnock-pleased-with-cup-win | title = Warnock Pleased with Cup Win | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | work = Sporting Life| date = 28 August 2012}} Byram remained a permanent feature in the first-team squad during the early months of the season with United legend [[Eddie Gray (footballer, born 1948)|Eddie Gray]] tipping him to win a call-up to [[England national under-21 football team|England Under-21]] squad in the near future if he maintained his form.{{Cite news | url = http://www.lufcchat.com/legends-on-leeds/gray-on-leeds | title = Gray on Leeds – Byram's got the goods to follow Lees' international call | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | publisher = LUFC Chat| date = 10 September 2012}} His former manager in the under-18s, [[Neil Redfearn]], stated that Byram's rise through the ranks at the club served as a good example for other promising youngsters including his former teammates in the academy side, Ross Killock, [[Dominic Poleon]] and Simon Lenighan.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120905/sams-a-shining-light-for-youngsters_2247585_2909567 | title = SAM'S A SHINING LIGHT FOR YOUNGSTERS | accessdate = 23 September 2012 | work = Sporting Life| date = 5 September 2012}} On 2 October, he scored his first league goal for Leeds in a 2–2 draw away to [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], heading in a cross from [[El Hadji Diouf]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19709796 "Bolton 2–2 Leeds"] BBC Sport. 2 October 2012. Retrieved 2 October 2012.{{cite web|title=DAVIES DOUBLE DENIES UNITED VICTORY|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20121002/davies-double-denies-united-victory_2247585_2936572|work=Leeds United A.F.C|accessdate=2 October 2012}} An away match at Leicester City on 5 March saw young Byram score his third goal for Leeds in a 1–1 draw. After his impressive form for Leeds linked him with [[Premier League]] interest,{{cite web|title=Sam Byram agrees new deal with Leeds United|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11715/8441406|work=Sky Sports News|accessdate=26 January 2013}} Byram signed a new contract with Leeds on 26 January 2013, to extend his stay at the club until 2016.{{cite web|title=SAM'S SET TO SIGN FOR THE FUTURE|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130126/sams-set-to-sign-for-the-future_2247585_3054085|work=Leeds United A.F.C|accessdate=26 January 2013}} He scored his second league goal for the club on 6 March, in a 1–1 draw away at [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]],[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21583959 "Leicester 1–1 Leeds"] BBC Sport. 6 March 2013. Retrieved 9 March 2013. and followed this up with the equaliser in another 1–1 draw, at home to [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]]. On 26 April 2013, Byram won the ''[[Yorkshire Evening Post]]'' Player of the Season award with 99% of the vote.{{Cite news | url = http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-byram-so-proud-to-be-youngest-winner-1-5623885 | title = Leeds United: Byram so proud to be youngest winner | accessdate = 27 April 2013 | work = Yorkshire Evening Post | date = 27 April 2013}} After being linked with an £8 million pound move to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the summer, Byram proclaimed that he wanted to stay at Leeds to try earn promotion.{{Cite news | url = http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-i-m-not-going-anywhere-byram-1-5623891 | title = I'm not going anywhere – Byram | accessdate = 27 April 2013 | work = Yorkshire Evening Post | date = 27 April 2013}} At the club's annual end of season awards on 27 April, Byram won the Player of the Year Award, Young Player of the Year Award, Players Player of the Year Award and also the Supporters Club Player of the Year Award.{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130427/sam-wins-the-big-prizes_2247585_3159534 | title = SAM WINS THE BIG PRIZES | accessdate = 28 April 2013 | publisher = Leeds United Official Website | date = 28 April 2013}} On 30 July 2013, Bryam was named in [[Sky Sports]] Football League Players to watch out for in the Football League.{{Cite news | url = http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11689/8841517/fl-125-championship | title = FL 125 Championship | accessdate = 30 July 2013 | publisher = Sky Sports | date = 30 July 2013}} ====2013–14 season==== The hip injury sustained at the end of the 2012–13 season ruled Byram out of the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20]]'s World Cup. Bryam's injury caused him to miss the entire 2013–14 pre-season friendlies for Leeds. After missing the start of the 2013–14 season, on 6 August Leeds manager [[Brian McDermott (footballer)|Brian McDermott]] announced that Byram had an injection in his hip and the injury may require surgery which could potentially rule him out for several months.{{Cite news | url = http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11688/8857913/championship-leeds-defender-sam-byram-may-be-sidelined-for-several-more-months | title = Leeds defender Sam Byram may be sidelined for several more months | accessdate = 6 August 2013 | publisher = Sky Sports | date = 6 August 2013}} Byram made his first-team return on 21 September 2013, playing 57 minutes in Leeds' 2–1 defeat against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]. He also played Leeds' next game, a League Cup defeat to Newcastle United, playing the full 90 minutes.{{Cite news | title = CUP EXIT AT NEWCASTLE | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/1oda3gwpk9f661mehsrci0fk83/title/cup-exit-at-newcastle | publisher = Leeds United A.F.C | date = 28 September 2013 | accessdate = 28 September 2013}} Byram played just 27 games during an injury hit season. ====2014–15 season==== On 1 August, Byram was assigned the Leeds number 2 shirt for the 2014–15 season.{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/1wncxa2kw0zr11fmlyjr0m3t53/title/squad-numbers-released|title=SQUAD NUMBERS RELEASED|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=1 August 2014 |accessdate=1 August 2014}} On 9 August, [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] manager [[Ronald Koeman]] confirmed that Leeds had rejected a bid of £4.5 million to sign Byram.{{Cite news | title = Southampton's £4.5m bid for young defender Sam Byram rejected by Leeds | url = http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/497450/Southampton-s-4-5m-bid-for-young-defender-Sam-Byram-rejected-by-Leeds | publisher = Express | date = 9 August 2014 | accessdate = 9 August 2014}} Byram was given a straight red card on 23 August against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] for an off the ball incident with Watford defender [[Daniel Pudil]].{{cite news|title=TWO OFF IN WATFORD DEFEAT|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=23 August 2014|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/sojpa30okel317a4kki4xhnbg/title/two-off-in-watford-defeat|publisher=Leeds United Official Site}} Byram scored his fourth goal for Leeds in a 2–1 win against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Hudderfield Town]] on 31 January. In 2015, head coach Neil Redfearn changed Leeds' formation to a 4–2–3–1 with Byram moved forward into an attacking right wing position, with [[Scott Wootton]] played as the regular right back. Byram scored the second goal in a 2–0 away win over [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 10 February.{{Cite web | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2948295/Reading-0-2-Leeds-United-Luke-Murphy-Sam-Byram-strike-seal-valuable-three-points-Neil-Redfearn-s-side.html | title = Reading 0 Leeds 2 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 10 February 2015 | accessdate = 10 February 2015 }} On 18 March 2015, Byram scored for Leeds United against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in a 3–0 away victory.{{cite news |title=Fulham 0 Leeds 3|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31827949|date=10 March 2015 |accessdate=10 March 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}} On 9 April, after rumoured Premier League interest in Byram and teammates [[Lewis Cook (footballer, born 1997)|Lewis Cook]], [[Charlie Taylor (footballer, born 1993)|Charlie Taylor]] and [[Alex Mowatt]], head coach Neil Redfearn challenged Leeds United's owners to keep a hold of their homegrown talents.{{cite news |title=Keep young stars, Redfearn challenges Leeds|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-keep-young-stars-redfearn-challenges-leeds-1-7202015 |date=9 April 2015 |accessdate=9 April 2015 |work=Yorkshire Evening Post}} On 2 May 2015, Byram was one of five players nominated for the Fans Player of the Year Award at Leeds United's official end of 2014–15 season awards ceremony, but lost out to eventual winner Alex Mowatt. Byram was also nominated for Young Player of the Year Award, but missed out on the Young Player of the Year award to Lewis Cook.{{cite news|title= MOWATT SCOOPS AWARDS NIGHT DOUBLE |date=2 May 2015|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/slzwndu1a9wb1kdweft4sskxz/title/mowatt-scoops-awards-night-double|publisher=Leeds United F.C.}} ====2015–16 season==== [[File:Sam Byram of West Ham United.jpg|right|140px|thumb|Byram with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], January 2016]] Byram started the pre-season for Leeds playing as a [[Forward (association football)|right forward]] in new manager [[Uwe Rösler]]'s 4–3–3 formation.{{cite news|title= Leeds United 2–0 Everton: Alex Mowatt and Chris Wood strikes condemn Toffees to comfortable defeat at Elland Road |date=1 August 2015|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3182261/Leeds-United-2-0-Everton-Alex-Mowatt-Chris-Wood-strikes-condemn-Toffees-comfortable-defeat-Elland-Road.html}} On 31 July 2015, Rösler revealed that despite speculation linking Byram to Premier League clubs,{{cite news|title= Everton eye £8million-rated Leeds right back Sam Byram as Manchester United weigh up bid for Seamus Coleman |date=30 June 2015|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3144001/Everton-eye-Leeds-right-Sam-Byram-replacement-Manchester-United-target-Seamus-Coleman.html}} that he was not looking to sell the player and that he was an important player for the club.{{cite news|title= Leeds United: Rosler fights to quell Byram speculation |date=31 July 2015|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-rosler-fights-to-quell-byram-speculation-1-7387748}}{{cite news|title= Rosler insists Leeds will not sell their best talent such as Sam Byram|date=2 August 2015|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3182630/Leeds-manager-Uwe-Rosler-determined-bring-glory-days-club-avoid-Massimo-Cellino-casualty.html}} On 12 August 2015, Byram missed a penalty in a penalty shootout against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] in the League Cup, with Leeds losing 4–2 on penalties after a 1–1 draw.{{cite news|publisher= Leeds United Official site | date= 12 August 2015 | accessdate= 12 August 2015 | title= DONCASTER: UNITED EXIT CUP ON PENALTIES | url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/tq9ka0mhwvog1wx1szbqrvwzk/title/doncaster-united-exit-cup-on-penalties}} On 22 September 2015, Byram was criticized by Leeds owner [[Massimo Cellino]] who revealed he was "deeply offended" and "hurt" that Byram had not signed a new contract with the club.{{cite news|publisher= Sky Sports | date= 22 September 2015 | accessdate= 22 September 2015 | title= Sam Byram 'refused' new deal, says 'hurt' Cellino | url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11715/10001590/sam-bryam-thinks-he-is-too-big-for-leeds-and-will-not-sign-new-contract-says-massimo-cellino}} The ''Yorkshire Evening Post'' reported that the contract offer from Cellino to Byram was actually a reduction on his existing wage on a long term deal.{{cite news|work= Yorkshire Evening Post | date= 22 September 2015 | accessdate= 22 September 2015 | title= Byram too big for his boots, blasts Leeds United chief Cellino| url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-utd/byram-too-big-for-his-boots-blasts-leeds-united-chief-cellino-1-7475166}} On 5 December 2015, Bryam turned down a further contract offer, with the offer being just a one-year extension, however parity of his current wage.{{cite news|work= Yorkshire Evening Post | date= 5 December 2015 | accessdate= 5 December 2015 | title= Leeds United: Sam Byram rejects contract offer | url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-lufc-news/leeds-united-sam-byram-rejects-contract-offer-1-7608795}} On 17 December 2015, Byram scored a brace in the match against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] to seal Leeds' 3–2 win.{{cite news|publisher= Leeds United F.C. | date= 17 December 2015 | accessdate= 17 December 2015 | title= REPORT: UNITED CLINCH THRILLER AT WOLVES | url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/6y2i8r7ed2df1112136hiey5c}} On 27 December, Byram scored in the match against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] to end the match at 1–1.{{cite news|publisher= Leeds United F.C. | date= 27 December 2015 | accessdate= 27 December 2015 | title= REPORT: BYRAM CLINCHES POINT AT FOREST | url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/19gaju3utrin11szuyl2bd1fwo}} On 5 January 2016, Byram was named Championship Player of the Month for December 2015 after scoring three goals and making assists throughout the month.{{cite news|publisher= Sky Sports News | date= 5 January 2016 | accessdate= 5 January 2016 | title= Mesut Ozil, Sam Byram lead PFA Fans' Player of the Month awards for December| url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10119042/mesut-ozil-lucas-joao-lead-pfa-fans-player-of-the-month-awards-for-november}} After being subject to enquiries from Premier League clubs, on 7 January 2016 Leeds manager [[Steve Evans (footballer, born 1962)|Steve Evans]] revealed that he wanted to keep Byram at the club but that club owner Massimo Cellino had advised the enquiries had not been concrete enough for a move to happen.{{cite news|title= EVANS PROVIDES LATEST TRANSFER NEWS |date=7 January 2016|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/1rdran2rlfwce1vd0xm4tsu3kt/title/evans-provides-latest-transfer-news|publisher=Leeds United F.C.}} Byram left Leeds in January 2016. He had played 143 games in all competitions for them, scoring 10 goals.{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/January/20-January/Hammers-sign-Sam-Byram | title=Hammers sign Sam Byram | publisher=West Ham United F.C. | date=20 January 2016 | accessdate=20 January 2016}} ===West Ham United=== ====2015–16 season==== Byram signed for Premier League club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a four-and-a-half year contract for an undisclosed fee on 20 January 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35364368|title=Sam Byram joins West Ham from Leeds United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 January 2016|accessdate=20 January 2016}} He made his West Ham debut as a 13th-minute substitute for the injured [[Carl Jenkinson]] on 23 January in a 2–2 draw against Manchester City. In his post-match interview, manager [[Slaven Bilić]] revealed that Byram had not been in the matchday squad but was a late inclusion following an injury to [[James Tomkins (footballer)|James Tomkins]].{{cite web | url=http://www.skysports.com/watch/video/sports/football/competitions/premier-league/10141816/bilic-proud-of-performance | title=Bilic proud of performance | publisher=Sky Sports | date=24 January 2016 | accessdate=24 January 2016}} ====2016–17 season==== On 29 July 2016, Byram made his first start and appearance of the season in a 2–1 defeat against Slovenian [[NK Domžale|Domžale]] in the first leg of the [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] third qualifying round tie.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/nk-domzale-vs-west-ham/362689 |title=NK Domzale 2–1 West Ham: Matic Crnic scores twice to stun Hammers in Europa League first leg |date=29 July 2016 |publisher=SkySports}} ===Notingham Forest loan=== On 10 August 2018, Byram joined [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on loan for the remainder of the 2018–19 season.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/august/10-august/sam-byram-joins-nottingham-forest-loan|title=Sam Byram joins Nottingham Forest on loan|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|accessdate=15 August 2018}} He made his debut for Forest on 14 August in the first round of the [[2018–19 EFL Cup]] against [[Bury F.C.|Bury]]. The game finished 1–1 after 90 minutes with Forest going through to the second round 10–9 on penalties, one of which Byram scored for Forest.{{cite web|url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2018/08/14/england/league-cup/nottingham-forest-fc/bury-fc/2796928/?ICID=PL_MS_01|title=Nottingham Forest vs. Bury – 14 August 2018|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=15 August 2018}} ==International career== On 17 May 2013, Byram was called up to the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20]] team by [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]] for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in Turkey.{{Cite news |url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130517/sams-confirmed-on-world-cup-short-list_2247585_3182143 |title = SAM'S CONFIRMED ON WORLD CUP SHORT-LIST |accessdate = 17 May 2013 |publisher = Leeds United official website |date = 17 May 2013 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130607115953/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130517/sams-confirmed-on-world-cup-short-list_2247585_3182143 |archivedate = 7 June 2013 |df = dmy-all }} On 11 June, however, he withdrew as a precaution due to a hip injury sustained towards the end of the 2012–13 season.{{Cite news |url =
